Back to top                  FireChick    Joined: 26 Mar 2006 		    Posts: 2097 		    Location: United States 		        Posted: Tue Apr 05, 2022 10:52 am            AAAAAAAAAAAA WITCH HAT ATELIER ANIMEEEEEEEEEEEEE!!!! I can't wait to see it!! WHA is one of the absolute best manga to come out in recent years!   My only message to the studio adapting it:      (Credit goes to the person who put the captions on the image)      Back to top                  ab2143    Joined: 09 Jan 2021 		    Posts: 453       Posted: Tue Apr 05, 2022 11:09 am            I'm both excited and scared. Will wait for the staff to be announced.      Back to top                  dm   Subscriber   Joined: 24 Sep 2010 		    Posts: 954       Posted: Tue Apr 05, 2022 11:20 am            The art in this manga is going to be hard to translate to animation.  I don't envy the character designer's job, trying to simplify the character designs for animation.   Plus: elaborate backgrounds.   Gosh, their clothes alone!      Back to top                  SHD    Joined: 05 Apr 2015 		    Posts: 1156       Posted: Tue Apr 05, 2022 11:20 am            Oh, cool. I've been trying to read this for ages, but for all the great things I've read about the manga it could just never keep my attention - not the manga's fault, btw, it's probably all on me. But now I'll have the next best thing, I guess.      Back to top                  blooperboy    Joined: 28 Dec 2021 		    Posts: 43       Posted: Tue Apr 05, 2022 11:26 am            Like those who posted before me, I'm excited about the series getting an anime, but trepidations about the execution. Witch Hat is similar to Berserk in that part of what makes it special is that art style and detail in everything. Anime inherently simplifies things so as to not kill its animators, so I worry that part of that magic will be lost when it inevitably gets streamlined. Some of the background detail could certainly be augmented with the improved CG of the day, but we've all seen CG done poorly and if its used on the characters it could Destroy the show.    All in all I'm like, 60% excited 40% nervous and will remain that way until we get more information about who's actually doing this.      Back to top                  musouka    Joined: 09 Sep 2003 		    Posts: 642       Posted: Tue Apr 05, 2022 11:59 am              SHD wrote:    Oh, cool. I've been trying to read this for ages, but for all the great things I've read about the manga it could just never keep my attention - not the manga's fault, btw, it's probably all on me. But now I'll have the next best thing, I guess.            I would say I'm "interested" in the series, but not particularly passionate about it.  It feels like there will eventually be big, exciting revelations about the world and the characters, but that they're years and years away, which I think can make it somewhat less of a must-read than the lavish artwork would indicate.      Back to top                  phia_one    Joined: 15 Jan 2012 		    Posts: 1613 		    Location: Pennsylvania 		        Posted: Tue Apr 05, 2022 12:00 pm            I've been sorta curious about this series, but every time it's mentioned I've never seen any mention about the characters. It's usually about the art or world building.      Back to top                  olgita    Joined: 09 Aug 2009 		    Posts: 88       Posted: Tue Apr 05, 2022 12:11 pm            Let it be KyoAni, pretty please?      Back to top                  -Matthew-    Joined: 12 Mar 2022 		    Posts: 55       Posted: Tue Apr 05, 2022 12:47 pm            Great news!!   I hope good studio will be in charge and all volumes published will be adapted! 24 episodes minimum should be!!      Back to top                  njprogfan   Collector Extraordinaire   Joined: 08 Feb 2007 		    Posts: 864 		    Location: A River Named Toms 		        Posted: Tue Apr 05, 2022 1:21 pm              olgita wrote:    Let it be KyoAni, pretty please?            I double agree with this      Back to top                    510    Joined: 27 Feb 2021 		    Posts: 48       Posted: Tue Apr 05, 2022 1:51 pm            Looks like loli-kino. I hope it's good.      Back to top                  Yune Amagiri    Joined: 28 Jul 2016 		    Posts: 582 		    Location: France 		        Posted: Tue Apr 05, 2022 2:01 pm            i kept telling to a friend: "I'm sure next month we will finally see this Witch hat atelier anime announcement" every month over the last 3 or so years " i can finally stop being a broken record, this serie really deserve a well-made animation.      Back to top                   dm   Subscriber   Joined: 24 Sep 2010 		    Posts: 954       Posted: Tue Apr 05, 2022 2:34 pm            Drifting Dragons was another art-heavy manga that managed an okay translation to animation (though others may disagree --- I seem to be pretty accepting and uncritical when it comes to animation).     And, well, Nausicaa of the Valley of the Wind. Back to top                  dm   Subscriber   Joined: 24 Sep 2010 		    Posts: 954       Posted: Tue Apr 05, 2022 11:20 am            The art in this manga is going to be hard to translate to animation. Back to top                  SHD    Joined: 05 Apr 2015 		    Posts: 1156       Posted: Tue Apr 05, 2022 11:20 am            Oh, cool. I've been trying to read this for ages, but for all the great things I've read about the manga it could just never keep my attention - not the manga's fault, btw, it's probably all on me. But now I'll have the next best thing, I guess.      Back to top                  blooperboy    Joined: 28 Dec 2021 		    Posts: 43       Posted: Tue Apr 05, 2022 11:26 am            Like those who posted before me, I'm excited about the series getting an anime, but trepidations about the execution. Witch Hat is similar to Berserk in that part of what makes it special is that art style and detail in everything. Anime inherently simplifies things so as to not kill its animators, so I worry that part of that magic will be lost when it inevitably gets streamlined. Some of the background detail could certainly be augmented with the improved CG of the day, but we've all seen CG done poorly and if its used on the characters it could Destroy the show.    All in all I'm like, 60% excited 40% nervous and will remain that way until we get more information about who's actually doing this.      Back to top                  musouka    Joined: 09 Sep 2003 		    Posts: 642       Posted: Tue Apr 05, 2022 11:59 am              SHD wrote:    Oh, cool. I've been trying to read this for ages, but for all the great things I've read about the manga it could just never keep my attention - not the manga's fault, btw, it's probably all on me. But now I'll have the next best thing, I guess.            I would say I'm "interested" in the series, but not particularly passionate about it.  It feels like there will eventually be big, exciting revelations about the world and the characters, but that they're years and years away, which I think can make it somewhat less of a must-read than the lavish artwork would indicate. All in all I'm like, 60% excited 40% nervous and will remain that way until we get more information about who's actually doing this.      Back to top                  musouka    Joined: 09 Sep 2003 		    Posts: 642       Posted: Tue Apr 05, 2022 11:59 am              SHD wrote:    Oh, cool. I've been trying to read this for ages, but for all the great things I've read about the manga it could just never keep my attention - not the manga's fault, btw, it's probably all on me. But now I'll have the next best thing, I guess.            I would say I'm "interested" in the series, but not particularly passionate about it.  It feels like there will eventually be big, exciting revelations about the world and the characters, but that they're years and years away, which I think can make it somewhat less of a must-read than the lavish artwork would indicate. Back to top                  SHD    Joined: 05 Apr 2015 		    Posts: 1156       Posted: Tue Apr 05, 2022 11:20 am            Oh, cool. I've been trying to read this for ages, but for all the great things I've read about the manga it could just never keep my attention - not the manga's fault, btw, it's probably all on me. But now I'll have the next best thing, I guess.      Back to top                  blooperboy    Joined: 28 Dec 2021 		    Posts: 43       Posted: Tue Apr 05, 2022 11:26 am            Like those who posted before me, I'm excited about the series getting an anime, but trepidations about the execution. Witch Hat is similar to Berserk in that part of what makes it special is that art style and detail in everything. Anime inherently simplifies things so as to not kill its animators, so I worry that part of that magic will be lost when it inevitably gets streamlined. Some of the background detail could certainly be augmented with the improved CG of the day, but we've all seen CG done poorly and if its used on the characters it could Destroy the show.    All in all I'm like, 60% excited 40% nervous and will remain that way until we get more information about who's actually doing this. Forum - View topicINTEREST: Utena, Penguindrum Director Ikuhara Announces Name Change            Goto page 1, 2, 3, 4  Next Note: this is the discussion thread for this article     Anime News Network Forum Index -> Site-related -> Talkback    View previous topic :: View next topic     Author Message        MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3799       Posted: Wed Mar 30, 2022 12:51 pm            Well, it's a very Ikuhara thing to do.      Back to top                  MarshalBanana    Joined: 31 Aug 2014 		    Posts: 4528       Posted: Wed Mar 30, 2022 1:25 pm            This is very disappointing. Why did he not go with a symbol, that way he could be called 'The Director Formally Known as Kunihiko Ikuhara'.      Back to top                    danpmss    Joined: 30 May 2015 		    Posts: 622       Posted: Wed Mar 30, 2022 1:34 pm            I mean, most people just refer to him as Ikuhara, I guess that's not particularly big of a name change overall.   inb4 it's the "prelude" for his announcement of an Oyasumi Punpun anime adaptation lol      Back to top                  SHD    Joined: 05 Apr 2015 		    Posts: 1156       Posted: Wed Mar 30, 2022 3:14 pm            And people in the weirder corner of his fandom are already being 100% certain that this means he just came out as trans. (Trans man? Trans woman? Non-binary? No-one seems to think that far!)   Disclaimer before anyone comes at me (oh who am I kidding), no, I wouldn't have a problem if he did come out as trans, but... he didn't. And yet I bet you'll see that narrative everywhere. Back to top                    danpmss    Joined: 30 May 2015 		    Posts: 622       Posted: Wed Mar 30, 2022 1:34 pm            I mean, most people just refer to him as Ikuhara, I guess that's not particularly big of a name change overall.   inb4 it's the "prelude" for his announcement of an Oyasumi Punpun anime adaptation lol      Back to top                  SHD    Joined: 05 Apr 2015 		    Posts: 1156       Posted: Wed Mar 30, 2022 3:14 pm            And people in the weirder corner of his fandom are already being 100% certain that this means he just came out as trans. (Trans man? Trans woman? Non-binary? No-one seems to think that far!)   Disclaimer before anyone comes at me (oh who am I kidding), no, I wouldn't have a problem if he did come out as trans, but... he didn't. And yet I bet you'll see that narrative everywhere. Disclaimer before anyone comes at me (oh who am I kidding), no, I wouldn't have a problem if he did come out as trans, but... he didn't. And yet I bet you'll see that narrative everywhere.            The article states that the announcement includes wording that is often associated with coming out.  That invites speculation.   Also Ikuhara's works are so infused with queerness that honestly, him actually being queer probably wouldn't be that big of a surprise to a lot of people.      Back to top                  garfield15    Joined: 06 Apr 2009 		    Posts: 1399       Posted: Wed Mar 30, 2022 3:51 pm              SHD wrote:    And people in the weirder corner of his fandom are already being 100% certain that this means he just came out as trans. (Trans man? Trans woman? Non-binary? No-one seems to think that far!)   Disclaimer before anyone comes at me (oh who am I kidding), no, I wouldn't have a problem if he did come out as trans, but... he didn't. And yet I bet you'll see that narrative everywhere.           I think it was the other way around, the way he was leading up to it made it sound like he was doing that (Saying stuff like, 'doing this may cast me out of society/create hardship/etc.') so that's what people were saying was gonna happen.  Which honestly would have been the least surprising reveal ever but then it ended up being this troll.   Such an Ikuni thing to do.      Back to top                  livin_large    Joined: 10 Nov 2021 		    Posts: 64       Posted: Wed Mar 30, 2022 4:00 pm              garfield15 wrote:    I think it was the other way around, the way he was leading up to it made it sound like he was doing that (Saying stuff like, 'doing this may cast me out of society/create hardship/etc.') so that's what people were saying was gonna happen.  Which honestly would have been the least surprising reveal ever but then it ended up being this troll.   Such an Ikuni thing to do.            That's what I assumed. It's like the X-Men movie when they joked about people "coming out" as a mutant to their parents.   It seems like an obvious bait and switch.      Back to top                  Zeino    Joined: 19 May 2017 		    Posts: 1060       Posted: Wed Mar 30, 2022 4:12 pm              garfield15 wrote:    I think it was the other way around, the way he was leading up to it made it sound like he was doing that (Saying stuff like, 'doing this may cast me out of society/create hardship/etc.') so that's what people were saying was gonna happen.  Which honestly would have been the least surprising reveal ever but then it ended up being this troll.   Such an Ikuni thing to do.            Yeah, with Ikuhara, you can never be entirely sure that this isn't an elaborate joke he is pulling on you. (See Miki's stopwatch contains the secrets of the universe, He wanted to kill Tuxedo Mask, The Penguindrum is a washing machine, etc)   But I'm more than willingly to go all with it serious or not and call him Bonsoir from now on if that is his wish.      Back to top                  Shenl742    Joined: 11 Feb 2010 		    Posts: 1522       Posted: Wed Mar 30, 2022 4:14 pm              livin_large wrote:       garfield15 wrote:    I think it was the other way around, the way he was leading up to it made it sound like he was doing that (Saying stuff like, 'doing this may cast me out of society/create hardship/etc.') so that's what people were saying was gonna happen.  Which honestly would have been the least surprising reveal ever but then it ended up being this troll.   Such an Ikuni thing to do.            That's what I assumed. It's like the X-Men movie when they joked about people "coming out" as a mutant to their parents.   It seems like an obvious bait and switch.            That scene was conceived by the director and one of the actors, who are both gay.  It wasn't a joke, it was an intended metaphor.      Back to top                  Hellfish    Joined: 19 Dec 2007 		    Posts: 391 		    Location: Mexico 		        Posted: Wed Mar 30, 2022 5:23 pm            This is on brand with Ikuhara, by this point if news came out of Bonsoir Ikuhara being X gender like Yu Watase, I wouldn’t be surprised.   Anyways, Bonsoir Bonsoir Ikuhara.    And I want to see the penguindr films      Back to top                  HoshizoranoUtage    Joined: 20 Jul 2020 		    Posts: 42       Posted: Wed Mar 30, 2022 6:17 pm            This feels like an early April Fool's joke...Then again, I don't know much about him himself but his anime series are quirky enough that I might see him saying something like this...or just trolling people for fun. Either way I'm glad Ikuhara found a new name he likes.      Back to top                  FunkyDude88    Joined: 01 Oct 2021 		    Posts: 72       Posted: Wed Mar 30, 2022 6:54 pm              Shenl742 wrote:    The article states that the announcement includes wording that is often associated with coming out.  That invites speculation.            Doing that to fictional characters is one thing, but head-canoning real life people is deeply creepy and invasive.      Back to top                  Dayraven    Joined: 21 Jul 2021 		    Posts: 128       Posted: Thu Mar 31, 2022 3:12 am              Quote:    Also Ikuhara's works are so infused with queerness that honestly, him actually being queer probably wouldn't be that big of a surprise to a lot of people.            And then there’s announcing it on Trans Day of Visibility, too.      Back to top                  MarshalBanana    Joined: 31 Aug 2014 		    Posts: 4528       Posted: Thu Mar 31, 2022 4:15 am              Shenl742 wrote:    Also Ikuhara's works are so infused with queerness          If we are honest most Anime is queer, even ones that take themselves seriously are still often strange. In comparison to some of the stuff Gainax put out, his work in comparison is quite normal. FLCL for example was really queer, with robots coming out of peoples heads and a giant iron in the middle of the town. Last edited by MarshalBanana on Thu Mar 31, 2022 5:28 am; edited 2 times in total     Back to top                    SHD    Joined: 05 Apr 2015 		    Posts: 1156       Posted: Thu Mar 31, 2022 4:21 am              Dayraven wrote:       Quote:    Also Ikuhara's works are so infused with queerness that honestly, him actually being queer probably wouldn't be that big of a surprise to a lot of people.            And then there’s announcing it on Trans Day of Visibility, too.           Still, he didn't come out as trans but as Bonsoir Ikuhara. If he knows that Trans Day of Visibility is a thing (I didn't, until last year) this looks more like a "har har coming out getit" joke than anything. If he doesn't, it just looks like what it does, him assuming a new name for whatever reason, with a jokey garnish.      Quote:    Also Ikuhara's works are so infused with queerness that honestly, him actually being queer probably wouldn't be that big of a surprise to a lot of people.           I think it's more like some people really want to claim him as their "own", and claiming to know intimate things about about a real person that he never actually disclosed or insinuated, just because they really want them to be true, is frankly quite creepy to me. (And that's beside my own problems with people worshipping Ikuhara as a queer icon.) Also Ikuhara's works are so infused with queerness that honestly, him actually being queer probably wouldn't be that big of a surprise to a lot of people.      Back to top                  garfield15    Joined: 06 Apr 2009 		    Posts: 1399       Posted: Wed Mar 30, 2022 3:51 pm              SHD wrote:    And people in the weirder corner of his fandom are already being 100% certain that this means he just came out as trans. (Trans man? Trans woman? Non-binary? No-one seems to think that far!)   Disclaimer before anyone comes at me (oh who am I kidding), no, I wouldn't have a problem if he did come out as trans, but... he didn't. And yet I bet you'll see that narrative everywhere.           I think it was the other way around, the way he was leading up to it made it sound like he was doing that (Saying stuff like, 'doing this may cast me out of society/create hardship/etc.') so that's what people were saying was gonna happen.  Which honestly would have been the least surprising reveal ever but then it ended up being this troll.   Such an Ikuni thing to do.      Back to top                  livin_large    Joined: 10 Nov 2021 		    Posts: 64       Posted: Wed Mar 30, 2022 4:00 pm              garfield15 wrote:    I think it was the other way around, the way he was leading up to it made it sound like he was doing that (Saying stuff like, 'doing this may cast me out of society/create hardship/etc.') so that's what people were saying was gonna happen.  Which honestly would have been the least surprising reveal ever but then it ended up being this troll.   Such an Ikuni thing to do.            That's what I assumed. It's like the X-Men movie when they joked about people "coming out" as a mutant to their parents.   It seems like an obvious bait and switch.      Back to top                  Zeino    Joined: 19 May 2017 		    Posts: 1060       Posted: Wed Mar 30, 2022 4:12 pm              garfield15 wrote:    I think it was the other way around, the way he was leading up to it made it sound like he was doing that (Saying stuff like, 'doing this may cast me out of society/create hardship/etc.') so that's what people were saying was gonna happen.  Which honestly would have been the least surprising reveal ever but then it ended up being this troll.   Such an Ikuni thing to do.            Yeah, with Ikuhara, you can never be entirely sure that this isn't an elaborate joke he is pulling on you. (See Miki's stopwatch contains the secrets of the universe, He wanted to kill Tuxedo Mask, The Penguindrum is a washing machine, etc)   But I'm more than willingly to go all with it serious or not and call him Bonsoir from now on if that is his wish.      Back to top                  Shenl742    Joined: 11 Feb 2010 		    Posts: 1522       Posted: Wed Mar 30, 2022 4:14 pm              livin_large wrote:       garfield15 wrote:    I think it was the other way around, the way he was leading up to it made it sound like he was doing that (Saying stuff like, 'doing this may cast me out of society/create hardship/etc.') so that's what people were saying was gonna happen.  Which honestly would have been the least surprising reveal ever but then it ended up being this troll.   Such an Ikuni thing to do.            That's what I assumed. It's like the X-Men movie when they joked about people "coming out" as a mutant to their parents.   It seems like an obvious bait and switch.            That scene was conceived by the director and one of the actors, who are both gay.  It wasn't a joke, it was an intended metaphor.      Back to top                  Hellfish    Joined: 19 Dec 2007 		    Posts: 391 		    Location: Mexico 		        Posted: Wed Mar 30, 2022 5:23 pm            This is on brand with Ikuhara, by this point if news came out of Bonsoir Ikuhara being X gender like Yu Watase, I wouldn’t be surprised.   Anyways, Bonsoir Bonsoir Ikuhara.    And I want to see the penguindr films      Back to top                  HoshizoranoUtage    Joined: 20 Jul 2020 		    Posts: 42       Posted: Wed Mar 30, 2022 6:17 pm            This feels like an early April Fool's joke...Then again, I don't know much about him himself but his anime series are quirky enough that I might see him saying something like this...or just trolling people for fun. Either way I'm glad Ikuhara found a new name he likes.      Back to top                  FunkyDude88    Joined: 01 Oct 2021 		    Posts: 72       Posted: Wed Mar 30, 2022 6:54 pm              Shenl742 wrote:    The article states that the announcement includes wording that is often associated with coming out.  That invites speculation.            Doing that to fictional characters is one thing, but head-canoning real life people is deeply creepy and invasive.      Back to top                  Dayraven    Joined: 21 Jul 2021 		    Posts: 128       Posted: Thu Mar 31, 2022 3:12 am              Quote:    Also Ikuhara's works are so infused with queerness that honestly, him actually being queer probably wouldn't be that big of a surprise to a lot of people.            And then there’s announcing it on Trans Day of Visibility, too.      Back to top                  MarshalBanana    Joined: 31 Aug 2014 		    Posts: 4528       Posted: Thu Mar 31, 2022 4:15 am              Shenl742 wrote:    Also Ikuhara's works are so infused with queerness          If we are honest most Anime is queer, even ones that take themselves seriously are still often strange. In comparison to some of the stuff Gainax put out, his work in comparison is quite normal. FLCL for example was really queer, with robots coming out of peoples heads and a giant iron in the middle of the town. Last edited by MarshalBanana on Thu Mar 31, 2022 5:28 am; edited 2 times in total     Back to top                    SHD    Joined: 05 Apr 2015 		    Posts: 1156       Posted: Thu Mar 31, 2022 4:21 am              Dayraven wrote:       Quote:    Also Ikuhara's works are so infused with queerness that honestly, him actually being queer probably wouldn't be that big of a surprise to a lot of people.            And then there’s announcing it on Trans Day of Visibility, too.           Still, he didn't come out as trans but as Bonsoir Ikuhara. If he knows that Trans Day of Visibility is a thing (I didn't, until last year) this looks more like a "har har coming out getit" joke than anything. If he doesn't, it just looks like what it does, him assuming a new name for whatever reason, with a jokey garnish.      Quote:    Also Ikuhara's works are so infused with queerness that honestly, him actually being queer probably wouldn't be that big of a surprise to a lot of people.           I think it's more like some people really want to claim him as their "own", and claiming to know intimate things about about a real person that he never actually disclosed or insinuated, just because they really want them to be true, is frankly quite creepy to me. (And that's beside my own problems with people worshipping Ikuhara as a queer icon.) Title: INTEREST: Utena, Penguindrum Director Ikuhara Announces Name Change [1/4] - Forum - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: I mean, most people just refer to him as Ikuhara, I guess that's not particularly big of a name change overall.   inb4 it's the "prelude" for his announcement of an Oyasumi Punpun anime adaptation lol

Title: INTEREST: Utena, Penguindrum Director Ikuhara Announces Name Change [1/4] - Forum - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: This feels like an early April Fool's joke...Then again, I don't know much about him himself but his anime series are quirky enough that I might see him saying something like this...or just trolling people for fun. Either way I'm glad Ikuhara found a new name he likes.

The volume (English cover pictured right) will go on sale at comic stores on November 9 and in bookstores on November 22. The site still lists the same staff and cast members. The first Urawa no Usagi-chan season will have a re-run on TV Saitama beginning on April 9. Title: Retail - Forum - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: ⬈ ⬋ - +                            feature                The Best and Worst of Winter 2022   Apr  6, 10:10                 anime    With the last few episodes trailing into Spring like an April's fool, it's time to look at the final ranking of the Winter 2022 season. And the trophy for "best final episode" goes to... ―  Let's have a look at what ANN readers consider the best (and worst) of the season, based on the polls you can find in our Daily Streaming Reviews and on the Your Score page with the latest simulcasts. Keep in mind...                    news          15 comments       Dark Horse to Publish 1st Berserk Manga Volume Since Kentarou Miura's Passing in November   Apr  6, 08:07 15 comments                 manga    41st manga volume shipped in Japan on December 24 ― Dark Horse Comics confirmed with Crunchyroll on Monday that it will release the 41st compiled book volume of Kentarou Miura's Berserk manga, which includes the final chapters that Miura had created for the series, in November. The volume (English cover pictured right) will go on sale at comic stores on November 9 and in bookstores on November 22. Th...                    news          4 comments       Urawa no Usagi-chan Anime Season 2 Musasino! Premieres in July After 5-Year Delay   Apr  6, 08:05 4 comments                 anime    Season originally slated for summer 2017 ― The official website for Musasino!, the second season of the Urawa no Usagi-chan anime, announced on Monday that the anime will premiere in July, after being delayed for five years. The site still lists the same staff and cast members. The first Urawa no Usagi-chan season will have a re-run on TV Saitama beginning on April 9. The Musasino! anime was original...                    news          4 comments       Chainsaw Man's Tatsuki Fujimoto to Release New 200-Page 1-Shot on April 11   Apr  6, 07:57 4 comments                 manga    Shueisha to release entire 1-shot on Shonen Jump+ ― Shihei Lin, an editor for works such as Spy x Family and Chainsaw Man, announced on Twitter on Monday that Chainsaw Man manga creator Tatsuki Fujimoto will release a new 200-page one-shot manga digitally on April 11. Shueisha will publish the manga on its Shonen Jump+ app and website. Fujimoto published a 140-page one-shot manga titled Look Back on ...                    column                The ANN Aftershow - Attack on Titan the Final Season: The Big Finale!   Apr  6, 00:30                 anime    We've reached the end of the road (almost, again)! Mikasa and Eren reflect back on the path of destruction. Was there ever a point when Eren could have been saved? ―  Attack on Titan the Final Season: The Big Finale! We've reached the end of the road (almost, again)! Mikasa and Eren reflect back on the path of destruction. Was there ever a point when Eren could have been saved? Can the world still be...                    column          4 comments       This Week in Anime - When in Rome, Bathe as the Romans Do   Apr  5, 21:00 4 comments                 anime    Thermae Romae Novae looks to reinvigorate Mari Yamazaki's historical comedy manga about bath culture with a brand new series on Netflix. Does this version manage to bring the silly charm or is its topic too niche? ―  Thermae Romae Novae looks to reinvigorate Mari Yamazaki's historical comedy manga about bath culture with a brand new series on Netflix. Does this version manage to bring the silly charm...                    feature          112 comments       The Spring 2022 Preview Guide   Apr  5, 08:11 112 comments                 anime    Being the strongest warrior isn't all it's cracked up to be! Leo is switching sides in I'M QUITTING HEROING! Also check out our reviews of Healer Girls, Magia Record, Trapped in a Dating Sim, Fanfare of Adolescence, Love Live Nijigasaki,  The Executioner and Her Way of Life, Science Fell in Love, Ya Boy, Kongming!, Legend of Galactic Heroes, and more! ― Adblock+ breaks this page, consider whitelisting...

The volume (English cover pictured right) will go on sale at comic stores on November 9 and in bookstores on November 22. Premieres in July After 5-Year Delay   Apr  6, 08:05 4 comments                 anime    Season originally slated for summer 2017 ― The official website for Musasino!, the second season of the Urawa no Usagi-chan anime, announced on Monday that the anime will premiere in July, after being delayed for five years. The site still lists the same staff and cast members. The first Urawa no Usagi-chan season will have a re-run on TV Saitama beginning on April 9. The Musasino! anime was original...                    news          4 comments       Chainsaw Man's Tatsuki Fujimoto to Release New 200-Page 1-Shot on April 11   Apr  6, 07:57 4 comments                 manga    Shueisha to release entire 1-shot on Shonen Jump+ ― Shihei Lin, an editor for works such as Spy x Family and Chainsaw Man, announced on Twitter on Monday that Chainsaw Man manga creator Tatsuki Fujimoto will release a new 200-page one-shot manga digitally on April 11. The site still lists the same staff and cast members. The first Urawa no Usagi-chan season will have a re-run on TV Saitama beginning on April 9. The Musasino! anime was original...

Animax (April 2022 Highlights)   Apr  4th 2022          Animax is available in the following channels in the region: https://www.Animax-asia.com/get-Animax    Anime fans can catch the first and exclusive premieres of their favorite anime series, including express title, The Demon Girl Next Door (season 2) airing in the same week as Japan on April 9 at 9pm. Other first and exclusive Asia premieres include the new seasons of returning fan-favorite anime series, such as the second season of Yashahime: Princess Half-Demon (The Second Act) on April 19 at 6:30pm, every Monday to Friday with back-to-back episodes; and the highly popular volleyball series Haikyu!! season 3 on April 20 at 9pm, every Monday to Thursday.  The Demon Girl Next Door Season 2 小惡魔女在街角 (第二季) First and Exclusive / Express Title – same week as Japan Comedy, Fantasy, Slice of Life | 12x30' | 2022 | Premieres Apr 9, Sat, 9pm Shamiko, the girl who woke up with a pair of horns and a tail, has constantly fought to lift the curse of the Dark Clan. With the sudden appearance of a new demon in town, how will this affect Shamiko and her friends in their adventure?  Yashahime: Princess Half-Demon - The Second Act 半妖的夜叉姫 (第二季) First and Exclusive Action, Fantasy |24x30' | 2021 | Premieres Apr 19, Mon-Fri, 6.30pm (B2B) Years after the events of InuYasha, Sesshomaru's daughter Towa is separated from her twin sister Setsuna and thrown to modern-day Japan through a portal, where she is then raised by Sota Higurashi. Three unexpected visitors appear at their door one day ten years later, including her sister Setsuna who has now become a Demon Slayer and Moroha, the daughter of InuYasha and Kagome. However, Towa discovers that Setsuna and Moroha have no memories of their past, so the girls embark on adventures to recover Setsuna's memories, as well as discover the truths of their linked destinies.  HAIKYU!! Season 3 排球少年!! (第三季) First and Exclusive Sports, Drama |10x30' | 2016 | Premieres 20 Apr, Mon-Thu, 9pm Third season of the highly popular volleyball series Karasuno High must defeat Shiratorizawa Academy to qualify for the national tournament. Karasuno have to use everything that they have learnt so far in order to gain an advantage over their mighty opponents. Filled with excitement and anticipation, both teams are determined to come out on top in the third season of HAIKYU!!  Timings are based on +8GMT (Singapore/Malaysia/Philippines/Indonesia)  About Animax Animax is Asia's leading destination for Japanese anime and offers a wide variety of programmes from popular genres such as action, romance, horror, supernatural, sci-fi, comedy and slice-of-life. Home to some of the biggest anime titles, which are simulcast with Japan, Animax entertains hardcore fans in more than 38.8 million homes across 13 territories in Asia. Hit series include Tokyo Revengers, Naruto, Fruits Basket, Haikyu!! and Mushoku Tensei: Jobless Reincarnation. Animax (April 2022 Highlights)   Apr  4th 2022          Animax is available in the following channels in the region: https://www.Animax-asia.com/get-Animax    Anime fans can catch the first and exclusive premieres of their favorite anime series, including express title, The Demon Girl Next Door (season 2) airing in the same week as Japan on April 9 at 9pm. Other first and exclusive Asia premieres include the new seasons of returning fan-favorite anime series, such as the second season of Yashahime: Princess Half-Demon (The Second Act) on April 19 at 6:30pm, every Monday to Friday with back-to-back episodes; and the highly popular volleyball series Haikyu!! season 3 on April 20 at 9pm, every Monday to Thursday.  The Demon Girl Next Door Season 2 小惡魔女在街角 (第二季) First and Exclusive / Express Title – same week as Japan Comedy, Fantasy, Slice of Life | 12x30' | 2022 | Premieres Apr 9, Sat, 9pm Shamiko, the girl who woke up with a pair of horns and a tail, has constantly fought to lift the curse of the Dark Clan. With the sudden appearance of a new demon in town, how will this affect Shamiko and her friends in their adventure?  Yashahime: Princess Half-Demon - The Second Act 半妖的夜叉姫 (第二季) First and Exclusive Action, Fantasy |24x30' | 2021 | Premieres Apr 19, Mon-Fri, 6.30pm (B2B) Years after the events of InuYasha, Sesshomaru's daughter Towa is separated from her twin sister Setsuna and thrown to modern-day Japan through a portal, where she is then raised by Sota Higurashi. Three unexpected visitors appear at their door one day ten years later, including her sister Setsuna who has now become a Demon Slayer and Moroha, the daughter of InuYasha and Kagome. However, Towa discovers that Setsuna and Moroha have no memories of their past, so the girls embark on adventures to recover Setsuna's memories, as well as discover the truths of their linked destinies.  HAIKYU!! Season 3 排球少年!! (第三季) First and Exclusive Sports, Drama |10x30' | 2016 | Premieres 20 Apr, Mon-Thu, 9pm Third season of the highly popular volleyball series Karasuno High must defeat Shiratorizawa Academy to qualify for the national tournament. Karasuno have to use everything that they have learnt so far in order to gain an advantage over their mighty opponents. Filled with excitement and anticipation, both teams are determined to come out on top in the third season of HAIKYU!!  Timings are based on +8GMT (Singapore/Malaysia/Philippines/Indonesia)  About Animax Animax is Asia's leading destination for Japanese anime and offers a wide variety of programmes from popular genres such as action, romance, horror, supernatural, sci-fi, comedy and slice-of-life. Home to some of the biggest anime titles, which are simulcast with Japan, Animax entertains hardcore fans in more than 38.8 million homes across 13 territories in Asia. Hit series include Tokyo Revengers, Naruto, Fruits Basket, Haikyu!! and Mushoku Tensei: Jobless Reincarnation. Title: Animax (April 2022 Highlights) - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: ข่าวสารและบทความของ Anime News Network ในรูปแบบภาษาไทย สามารถติดตามอ่านได้แล้วที่ DEXclub         กรุณาเข้าไปเยี่ยมชมได้ที่ news.dexclub.com เพื่อติดตามอ่านข่าวสารล่าสุดในรูปแบบภาษาไทย          Anime News Network's news and articles are available in Thai from DEXclub.         Visit news.dexclub.com for all the latest news in Thai.                Animax (April 2022 Highlights)   Apr  4th 2022          Animax is available in the following channels in the region: https://www.Animax-asia.com/get-Animax    Anime fans can catch the first and exclusive premieres of their favorite anime series, including express title, The Demon Girl Next Door (season 2) airing in the same week as Japan on April 9 at 9pm. Other first and exclusive Asia premieres include the new seasons of returning fan-favorite anime series, such as the second season of Yashahime: Princess Half-Demon (The Second Act) on April 19 at 6:30pm, every Monday to Friday with back-to-back episodes; and the highly popular volleyball series Haikyu!! season 3 on April 20 at 9pm, every Monday to Thursday.  The Demon Girl Next Door Season 2 小惡魔女在街角 (第二季) First and Exclusive / Express Title – same week as Japan Comedy, Fantasy, Slice of Life | 12x30' | 2022 | Premieres Apr 9, Sat, 9pm Shamiko, the girl who woke up with a pair of horns and a tail, has constantly fought to lift the curse of the Dark Clan. With the sudden appearance of a new demon in town, how will this affect Shamiko and her friends in their adventure?  Yashahime: Princess Half-Demon - The Second Act 半妖的夜叉姫 (第二季) First and Exclusive Action, Fantasy |24x30' | 2021 | Premieres Apr 19, Mon-Fri, 6.30pm (B2B) Years after the events of InuYasha, Sesshomaru's daughter Towa is separated from her twin sister Setsuna and thrown to modern-day Japan through a portal, where she is then raised by Sota Higurashi. Three unexpected visitors appear at their door one day ten years later, including her sister Setsuna who has now become a Demon Slayer and Moroha, the daughter of InuYasha and Kagome. However, Towa discovers that Setsuna and Moroha have no memories of their past, so the girls embark on adventures to recover Setsuna's memories, as well as discover the truths of their linked destinies.  HAIKYU!! Season 3 排球少年!! (第三季) First and Exclusive Sports, Drama |10x30' | 2016 | Premieres 20 Apr, Mon-Thu, 9pm Third season of the highly popular volleyball series Karasuno High must defeat Shiratorizawa Academy to qualify for the national tournament. Karasuno have to use everything that they have learnt so far in order to gain an advantage over their mighty opponents. Filled with excitement and anticipation, both teams are determined to come out on top in the third season of HAIKYU!!  Timings are based on +8GMT (Singapore/Malaysia/Philippines/Indonesia)  About Animax Animax is Asia's leading destination for Japanese anime and offers a wide variety of programmes from popular genres such as action, romance, horror, supernatural, sci-fi, comedy and slice-of-life. Home to some of the biggest anime titles, which are simulcast with Japan, Animax entertains hardcore fans in more than 38.8 million homes across 13 territories in Asia. Hit series include Tokyo Revengers, Naruto, Fruits Basket, Haikyu!! and Mushoku Tensei: Jobless Reincarnation. HAIKYU!! Season 3 排球少年!! (第三季) First and Exclusive Sports, Drama |10x30' | 2016 | Premieres 20 Apr, Mon-Thu, 9pm Third season of the highly popular volleyball series Karasuno High must defeat Shiratorizawa Academy to qualify for the national tournament. Karasuno have to use everything that they have learnt so far in order to gain an advantage over their mighty opponents. Filled with excitement and anticipation, both teams are determined to come out on top in the third season of HAIKYU!!  Timings are based on +8GMT (Singapore/Malaysia/Philippines/Indonesia)  About Animax Animax is Asia's leading destination for Japanese anime and offers a wide variety of programmes from popular genres such as action, romance, horror, supernatural, sci-fi, comedy and slice-of-life. Home to some of the biggest anime titles, which are simulcast with Japan, Animax entertains hardcore fans in more than 38.8 million homes across 13 territories in Asia. Hit series include Tokyo Revengers, Naruto, Fruits Basket, Haikyu!! and Mushoku Tensei: Jobless Reincarnation.  Website: Animax-Asia.com | Facebook: @AnimaxAsia | Twitter: @AnimaxAsiaTV | Instagram: @Ookun | YouTube: Animax Asia

Keep in mind...                    news          15 comments       Dark Horse to Publish 1st Berserk Manga Volume Since Kentarou Miura's Passing in November   Apr  6, 08:07 15 comments                 manga    41st manga volume shipped in Japan on December 24 ― Dark Horse Comics confirmed with Crunchyroll on Monday that it will release the 41st compiled book volume of Kentarou Miura's Berserk manga, which includes the final chapters that Miura had created for the series, in November. The volume (English cover pictured right) will go on sale at comic stores on November 9 and in bookstores on November 22. The site still lists the same staff and cast members. The first Urawa no Usagi-chan season will have a re-run on TV Saitama beginning on April 9. Shueisha will publish the manga on its Shonen Jump+ app and website. The volume (English cover pictured right) will go on sale at comic stores on November 9 and in bookstores on November 22. The site still lists the same staff and cast members. The first Urawa no Usagi-chan season will have a re-run on TV Saitama beginning on April 9. Shueisha will publish the manga on its Shonen Jump+ app and website.
